Authors: Arian Farid, Alan R Franck, James Roy Garey
Title:
Investigations in the boletes (Boletaceae) of southeastern
USA: four novel species and three novel combinations
Abstract:
The Boletaceae is the largest family of fleshy fungi in
the Boletales. Despite the extensive history of work in the Boletaceae
in North America, novel species and genera are continually being
described. Multigene molecular phylogenetic analyses of five loci were
combined with thorough morphological studies of several boletes from the
southeastern USA. Based on our results, we describe four new species
found in the southeastern USA, Aureoboletus pseudoauriporus,
Cyanoboletus bessettii, Hemileccinum floridanum, and Xerocomellus
bolinii. We also propose three combinations to reflect the results of
our molecular analyses; Cyanoboletus cyaneitinctus comb. nov., a bolete
that is widespread across the eastern USA, C. cyaneitinctus
f. reticulatus, and Lanmaoa sublurida, a rarely-documented bolete that
is so far known only from Florida.
